books.models module¶

class books.models.Book(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

Represents a book available in the online bookstore.

Fields:

title (CharField): The title of the book. author (CharField): The author’s name. description (TextField): A detailed summary of the book. price (DecimalField): The retail price of the book. cover_image (ImageField): Optional image of the book’s cover. release_date (DateField): Optional release date of the book. is_popular (BooleanField): Flag to mark book as popular. is_upcoming (BooleanField): Flag to indicate if the book is unreleased.

Returns:

Title of the book.

Return type:

str

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

author¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

cartitem_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

cover_image¶

Just like the FileDescriptor, but for ImageFields. The only difference is assigning the width/height to the width_field/height_field, if appropriate.

description¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

In the example:

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class books.models.Cart(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

Represents a shopping cart linked to a single user.

Fields:

user (OneToOneField): The user who owns the cart. created_at (DateTimeField): Timestamp when the cart was created.

Properties:

total_price (Decimal): The total cost of all items in the cart.

Returns:

A string indicating the cart owner.

Return type:

str

user¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

user_id¶
class books.models.CartItem(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

Represents a single book and its quantity in a user’s cart.

Fields:

cart (ForeignKey): Reference to the user’s cart. book (ForeignKey): The book being added to the cart. quantity (PositiveIntegerField): The number of copies.

Properties:

total_price (Decimal): Total price for this line item (price * quantity).

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class books.models.Review(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

Stores a review submitted by a user for a specific book.

Fields:

book (ForeignKey): Reference to the reviewed book. user (ForeignKey): The user who submitted the review. content (TextField): The body of the review. created_at (DateTimeField): Timestamp when the review was created.

Returns:

Username and book title of the review.

Return type:

str

class books.models.UpcomingBook(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

Represents a book that is planned for future release.

Fields:

title (CharField): The title of the upcoming book. author (CharField): The author’s name. release_date (DateField): The expected release date. cover_image (ImageField): Optional cover image of the upcoming book. description (TextField): Optional short summary.

Returns:

Title of the upcoming book.

Return type:

str

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

books.tests module¶

books.urls module¶

books.views module¶

books.views.add_review(request, pk)¶

Allow a logged-in user to submit a review for a specific book.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object (must be POST to submit).

  • pk (int) – Primary key of the book being reviewed.

Returns:

Redirects to book detail page on success, or shows review form.

Return type:

HttpResponse

books.views.add_to_cart(request, book_id)¶

Add a book to the logged-in user’s cart.

If the book is already in the cart, increments its quantity.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request.

  • book_id (int) – ID of the book to add to the cart.

Returns:

Redirect to cart detail page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

books.views.book_detail(request, pk)¶

Display details and reviews of a specific book.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • pk (int) – Primary key of the book.

Returns:

Rendered detail page for the selected book.

Return type:

HttpResponse

books.views.book_list(request)¶

Display a list of books with optional search filtering.

If a query parameter (q) is provided, filters books by title or author. Otherwise, displays all books.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request containing optional ‘q’ parameter.

Returns:

Rendered book list view with search results or full list.

Return type:

HttpResponse

books.views.cart_detail(request)¶

Display the current user’s cart contents.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request.

Returns:

Rendered cart detail page with cart items.

Return type:

HttpResponse

books.views.home(request)¶

Render the homepage with key dynamic content.

Retrieves and displays: - The 5 nearest upcoming book releases. - The 5 most popular books (where is_popular=True). - The 5 most recent reviews with related book and user data.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered homepage with context data.

Return type:

HttpResponse

books.views.remove_from_cart(request, item_id)¶

Remove a specific item from the user’s cart.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request.

  • item_id (int) – The CartItem ID to remove.

Returns:

Redirect to the cart detail page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

books.views.signup(request)¶

Handle new user registration.

On successful submission, logs in the user and redirects to the homepage.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request with optional POST data.

Returns:

Renders registration form or redirects on successful sign-up.

Return type:

HttpResponse

books.views.upcoming_book_detail(request, pk)¶

Show detailed view of a specific upcoming book.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request.

  • pk (int) – Primary key of the upcoming book.

Returns:

Rendered detail view of the upcoming book.

Return type:

HttpResponse

books.views.upcoming_books(request)¶

Display a full list of upcoming book releases.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request.

Returns:

Rendered list view of all upcoming books.

Return type:

HttpResponse

books.views.upload_upcoming_book(request)¶

Allow staff users to upload an upcoming book (title, cover, date, etc.).

Accepts both GET and POST. Requires user to be logged in. Files (like book covers) must be handled via request.FILES.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request, possibly with form data.

Returns:

Form for upload or redirect to home on success.

Return type:

HttpResponse
